item.title: Floating Point Numbers
item.description: Floating point numbers Take a look at the following calculation, written in Ruby. 0.1 + 0.2 => 0.30000000000000004 You may be wondering why the answer isn’t simply 0.3. Well, it is because we just encountered a floating point error. High five! ðŸ™Œ Let’s break it down to figure out why that happens. To start thinking about floating numbers we can think about the problem of storing numbers in a computer.
